result.execSummary:
The defendant Mario Daryl Woods was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Mario Daryl Woods is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Mario Daryl Woods was found guilty of Manufacture/Deliver Cocaine (<=1g) [Modifiers: Party to a Crime, Use of a Dangerous Weapon], a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(cm)1g.
  • Mario Daryl Woods was found guilty of Manufacture/Deliver Cocaine (<=1g) [Modifiers: Party to a Crime], a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(cm)1g.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
AS TO EACH COUNT:  Court costs, fees, assessments and surcharges including DNA surcharge.  To be paid through collection by DOC from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.5(4)(b). Any bail on deposit to apply. Any remaining shall be due by 7/1/2018. Failure to pay will result in an entry of civil judgment.
Fine set at zero.

Concurrent with: AS TO EACH COUNT, COUNT ONE AND THREE:  Concurrent with each other, but consecutive to any other sentence.  Credit for four (4) days.  11/4/14 to 11/8/2014.
***Under Section 973.049 Court finds and prohibits contact with Deandre M. dob 11/13/1987 as they were both coactors.  Court prohibits contact during confinement and during Extended Supervision.

Defendant Mario Daryl Woods in court with attorney Steven R. Kohn.  Brandon A Wigley appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: tmk. 
Court lifted stayed warrant. Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant. 

AS TO COUNT 1-
The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of 5 YEARS concurrent with count 3, but consecutive to any other sentence, with credit for 4 days time served (11-04-2014 to 11-08-2014); the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 3 YEARS; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 2 YEARS.  

Defendant is NOT eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program or the Substance Abuse Program. 

- Fine is set at ZERO.
- Provide DNA sample, if not already done. 
- Court costs, fees, assessments and surcharges, including the DNA surcharge to paid through collection by the department of Corrections from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b). Any cash bail on deposit to apply.  Any remaining shall be due by 07-01-2018; failure to pay will result in an entry of civil judgment. 

AS TO COUNT 3-
The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of 7 YEARS concurrent with count 1, but consecutive to any other sentence, with credit for 4 days time served (11-04-2014 to 11-08-2014);the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 3 YEARS; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 4 YEARS.  

Defendant is NOT eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program or the Substance Abuse Program. 

- Fine is set at ZERO.
- Provide DNA sample, if not already done. 
- Court costs, fees, assessments and surcharges, including the DNA surcharge to paid through collection by the department of Corrections from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b). Any cash bail on deposit to apply.  Any remaining shall be due by 07-01-2018; failure to pay will result in an entry of civil judgment. 

CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION:

- Maintain Absolute Sobriety: No use or possession/use of alcohol or controlled substances without a valid prescription taken in the manner and fashion as prescribed.
- Defendant to participate in Alcohol and Drug Assessment and successfully complete recommended treatment including drug and alcohol testing. 
- No possession of any drug paraphernalia for personal use, manufacturing, delivering or for distribution.
- Defendant is not to possess cash currency in an amount greater than $200.00 at one time.
- No possession of more than one cell phone at any one time.
- Defendant my not have more than one phone number registered to you name at one time. 
- No possession of any firearms or weapons, firearm ammunition, firearm magazine, firearm holster, or any body armor.
- Defendant may not live where a firearm is kept. 
- Defendant may not be in any automobile where a firearm is present. 
- Seek/ Maintain fulltime employment. 
- Defendant to not associate with any known gang member, associate or affiliate. 
- No contact with any known illegal drug manufacturer or deliverer.
- Under section 973.049 Court finds and prohibits contact with Deandre M. (DOB 11-13-1987) as they were both co actors. Court prohibits contact during confinement and during Extended Supervision.
- Court ordered Defendant to comply with all child support court orders.
- Complete Parenting or Fatherhood course. 

Pursuant to Wisconsin Statutes section 973.176, the Court advised the defendant of the following restrictions:  Firearm possession and Voting.

Appellate rights notice given to the defendant.

Attorney Steven R. Kohn in court, defendant Mario Daryl Woods not in court, in custody. Danielle Chojnacki on bahalf of Brandon A Wigley appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: tmk.
Case set for sentencing hearing. Defendant appeared prior to case being called. Court was informed defendant left before case was called. Paris M., citizen appeared to inform Court defendant went to the hospital. Court will no take action at this time.  Court ordered a bench warrant issued but stayed the issuance until 06-29-2015 at 1:30 pm, for sentencing hearing, Br. 17.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for June 29, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Letters on behalf of defendant received and filed. tk

Defendant Mario Daryl Woods in court with attorney Steven R. Kohn.  Danielle Chojnacki on behalf of Brandon A Wigley appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: tmk.
Case set for final pretrial. Plea hearing proceeded.  

AS TO COUNT 1 AND 3  - The defendant was advised of his constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights, Jury Instructions and Addendum to Plea Questionnaire and Waiver of Rights received and filed.  The parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  The Court found the defendant guilty and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction.
Pursuant to Wisconsin Statutes section 973.176, the Court advised the defendant of the following restrictions:  Firearm possession and Voting.

AS TO COUNT 2:  Pursuant to plea negotiations and on motion of State, Court ordered count dismissed.

Case is adjourned for sentencing hearing, Br 17. Jury trial May 4, 2015 is vacated. Sentencing hearing scheduled for June 12, 2015 at 1:30 pm.
